member.name: T:CsScript
member.summary: class for executing c# script.

member.name: M:CsScript.RunScript(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String@,System.String[])
member.summary: Compiles .cs script into dll/pdb, loads as assembly, and executes Main function. Temporary dll/pdb gets deleted. If .cs throws exception - it will be converted to error information, including .cs filename and source code line information.
member.param: Path to script which to execute

When this parameter is set to true, produced assembly will be kept next to C# script path. This also means that StackTrace will be able to display correct source code path and code line, unlike when loaded into ram false - if you don't care about source code position
true if allow to throw exceptions

member.name: T:Project
member.summary: Represents Visual studio project .xml model

member.name: F:Project.solution
member.summary: Solution where project is included from. null if project loaded as standalone.

member.name: F:Project.bIsFolder
member.summary: true if it's folder (in solution), false if it's project. (default)

member.name: F:Project.bIsPackagingProject
member.summary: true if it's Android packaging project

member.name: F:Project.bDefinedAsExternal
member.summary: Don't generate project if defined as externalproject

member.name: P:Project.ProjectHostGuid
member.summary: Made as a property so can be set over reflection.

member.name: M:Project.setOsBase(System.String)
member.summary: Sets os base, returns false if not supported.

member.name: F:Project.WindowsTargetPlatformVersion
member.summary: Target Platform Version, e.g. "8.1" or "10.0.14393.0"

member.name: F:Project.RelativePath
member.summary: Sub-folder and filename of project to save. language defines project file extension

member.name: M:Project.getRelativePath
member.summary: gets relative path based on programming language

member.name: M:Project.getProjectFolder
member.summary: Gets folder where project will be saved in.

member.name: F:Project.slnConfigurations
member.summary: Same amount of configurations as in solution, this however lists project configurations, which correspond to solution configuration using same index.

member.name: F:Project.configurations
member.summary: List of supported configuration|platform permutations, like "Debug|Win32", "Debug|x64" and so on.

member.name: M:Project.getConfigurationNames
member.summary: Gets list of supported configurations like 'Debug' / 'Release'

member.name: M:Project.getPlatforms
member.summary: Gets list of supported platforms like 'Win32' / 'x64'

member.name: F:Project.slnBuildProject
member.summary: true or false whether to build project or not.

member.name: F:Project.slnDeployProject
member.summary: true to deploy project, false - not, null - invalid. List is null if not used at all.

member.name: F:Project.projectConfig
member.summary: per configuration list

member.name: P:Project.ProjectDependencies
member.summary: Project dependent guids. Set to null if not used.

member.name: F:Project.files
member.summary: This array includes all items from ItemGroup, independently whether it's include file or file to compile, because visual studio is ordering them alphabetically - we keep same array to be able to sort files.

member.name: M:Project.getConfiguration(System.Xml.Linq.XElement)
member.summary: Extracts configuration name in readable form. Condition="'$(Configuration)|$(Platform)'=='Debug|x64'" => "Debug|x64"

member.name: M:Project.ExtractCompileOptions(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,FileInfo,System.String)
member.summary: Extracts compilation options for single cpp/cs file.
member.param: xml node from where to get
Into which field to enter if non null

member.name: M:Project.LoadProject(Solution,System.String,Project)
member.summary: Loads project. If project exists in solution, it's loaded in same instance.
member.param: Solution if any exists, null if not available.

member.name: M:Project.DumpConfiguration(FileConfigurationInfo,System.String,Configuration)
member.summary: Dumps file or project specific configuration.
member.param: Configuration name, null if project wise
Project configuration, null if conf is file specific configuration

member.name: M:Project.getSortedConfigurations(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Resorts configuration list in some particular order.
member.param: 64 bit configurations have priority. null if not use this sort criteria.
true if compare config name first

member.name: M:Project.XmlEscape(System.String)
member.summary: Escapes xml special characters. http://weblogs.sqlteam.com/mladenp/archive/2008/10/21/Different-ways-how-to-escape-an-XML-string-in-C.aspx

member.summary: Saves project if necessary.

member.summary: Create precompiled headers

member.name: F:EPrecompiledHeaderUse.Use
member.summary: Use precompiled headers

member.name: F:EPrecompiledHeaderUse.NotUsing
member.summary: Default value (not initialized)

member.name: F:EPrecompiledHeaderUse.ProjectDefault
member.summary: Not available in project file, but this is something we indicate that we haven't set value for precompiled headers.

member.name: T:EWarningLevel
member.summary: Specifies the level of warning to be generated by the compiler.

member.name: F:EWarningLevel.TurnOffAllWarnings
member.summary: Level 0 disables all warnings.

member.name: F:EWarningLevel.Level1
member.summary: Level 1 displays severe warnings. Level 1 is the default setting.

member.name: F:EWarningLevel.Level2
member.summary: Level 2 displays all level 1 warnings and warnings that are less severe than level 1.

member.name: F:EWarningLevel.Level3
member.summary: Level 3 displays all level 2 warnings and all other warnings that are recommended for production purposes.

member.name: F:EWarningLevel.Level4
member.summary: Level 4 displays all level 3 warnings and informational warnings. We recommend that you use this option only to provide lint-like warnings. However, for a new project, it may be best to use /W4 in all compilations; this will ensure the fewest possible hard-to-find code defects.

member.name: F:EWarningLevel.EnableAllWarnings
member.summary: Displays all /W4 warnings and any other warnings that are not included in /W4â€”for example, warnings that are off by default.

member.name: T:IncludeType
member.summary: Defines what needs to be done with given item. Not all project types support all enumerations - for example packaging projects / C# projects does not support CustomBuild.

member.summary: Header file (.h)

member.name: F:IncludeType.CustomBuild

member.name: F:IncludeType.Image

member.name: F:IncludeType.Invalid
member.summary: Intentionally not valid value, so can be replaced with correct one. (Visual studio does not supports one)

member.name: T:SolutionProjectBuilder
member.summary: Helper class for generating solution or projects.

member.name: F:SolutionProjectBuilder.m_solution
member.summary: Currently selected active solution on which all function below operates upon. null if not selected yet.

member.name: F:SolutionProjectBuilder.m_project
member.summary: Currently selected active project on which all function below operates upon. null if not selected yet.

member.name: F:SolutionProjectBuilder.m_workPath
member.summary: Path where we are building solution / project at. By default same as script is started from.

member.name: F:SolutionProjectBuilder.m_scriptRelativeDir
member.summary: Relative directory from solution. Set by RunScript.

member.name: F:SolutionProjectBuilder.bEverythingIsOk
member.summary: Just an indicator that we did not have any exception.

member.name: T:SolutionProjectBuilder.Destructor
member.summary: Execute once for each invocation of script. Not executed if multiple scripts are included.

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.solution(System.String)
member.summary: Creates new solution.

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.vsver(System.Int32)
member.summary: Specifies Visual studio version upon which given solution is targetted.

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.platforms(System.String[])
member.summary: Specify platform list to be used for your solution or project. For example: platforms("x32", "x64");

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.configurations(System.String[])
member.summary: Specify which configurations to support. Typically "Debug" and "Release".

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.GenerateGuid(System.String)
member.summary: Generates Guid based on String. Key assumption for this algorithm is that name is unique (across where it it's being used) and if name byte length is less than 16 - it will be fetched directly into guid, if over 16 bytes - then we compute sha-1 hash from string and then pass it to guid.
member.param: Unique name which is unique across where this guid will be used.

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.externalproject(System.String)
member.summary: Add to solution reference to external project. Call with null parameter to flush currently active project (Either to solution or to disk).

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.project(System.String)
member.summary: Adds new project to solution

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.osbase(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies IDE / OS where project is targetted upon. This function also sets default toolset, so if you want to override default toolset, specify it manually after this function call.
member.param: One of following: vs2010, vs2012, vs2015, android, package

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.location(System.String)
member.summary: The location function sets the destination directory for a generated solution or project file.

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.uuid(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies project uuid - could be written in form of normal guid ("{5E40B384-095E-452A-839D-E0B62833256F}") - use this kind of syntax if you need to produce your project in backwards compatible manner - so existing solution can load your project. Could be also written in any string form, but you need to take care that string is unique enough accross where your project is used. For example project("test1"); uuid("test"); project("test1"); uuid("test"); will result in two identical project uuid's and Visual studio will try to resave your project with changed uuid.
member.param: Project uuid or some unique name

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.language(System.String)
member.summary: Sets project programming language (reflects to used project extension)

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.dependson(System.String[])
member.summary: Specify one or more non-linking project build order dependencies.
member.param: List of dependent project. Can include only project name. Can include first guid and then project path. (For android packaging project)

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.group(System.String)
member.summary: Sets current "directory" where project should be placed.

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.invokeScript(System.String)
member.summary: Invokes C# Script by source code path. If any error, exception will be thrown.

member.name: F:SolutionProjectBuilder.selectedFileConfigurations
member.summary: Selected configurations (Either project global or file specific) selected by filter. selectedFileConfigurations is file specific, selectedConfigurations is project wide.

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.getSelectedConfigurations(System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets currently selected configurations by filter.
member.param: true to force project specific configuration set.
Tells how many call call frame behind is end-user code. (Non syncproj code). (Reflects to error reporting)

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.getSelectedProjectConfigurations
member.summary: Gets project configuration list, throw exception if cannot be found

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.filter(System.String[])
member.summary: Selects to which configurations to apply subsequent function calls (like "kind", "symbols", "files" and so on...)
member.param: Either configuration name, for example "Debug" / "Release" or by platform name, for example: "platforms:Win32", "platforms:x64" or by file name, for example: "files:my.cpp"

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.kind(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies application type, one of following:
member.param:
WindowedApp, Application - Window application
DynamicLibrary, SharedLib - .dll

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.toolset(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Selects the compiler, linker, etc. which are used to build a project or configuration.
member.param:
For example:
'v140' - for Visual Studio 2015.
'v120' - for Visual Studio 2013.
Tells how many call call frame behind is end-user code. (Non syncproj code). (Reflects to error reporting)

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.androidapilevel(System.String)
member.summary: Sets current android api level. Default is "android-19".

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.useofstl(System.String)
member.summary: Sets specific STL library for Android platform.

member.summary: Selects character set.

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.targetdir(System.String)

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.objdir(System.String)

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.targetname(System.String)

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.targetextension(System.String)

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.pchheader(System.String)

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.pchsource(System.String)

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.symbols(System.String)
member.summary: Specified whether debug symbols are enabled or not.
member.param:
"on" - debug symbols are enabled
"off" - debug symbols are disabled
"fastlink" - debug symbols are enabled + faster linking enabled.

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.includedirs(System.String[])
member.summary: Specifies additional include directories.

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.defines(System.String[])
member.summary: Specifies additional defines.

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.matchFiles(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Matches files from folder _dir using glob file pattern. In glob file pattern matching * reflects to any file or folder name, ** refers to any path (including sub-folders). ? refers to any character.
There exists also 3-rd party library for performing similar matching - 'Microsoft.Extensions.FileSystemGlobbing' but it was dragging a lot of dependencies, I've decided to survive without it.
member.returns: List of files matches your selection

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.files(System.String[])
member.summary: Adds one or more file into project.

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.buildrule(CustomBuildRule)
member.summary: Specifies custom build rule for specific file.

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.projectScript(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Configures project rebuild step.
member.param: Script which shall be compiled once script2include is changed

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.flags(System.String[])
member.summary: Enables certain flags for specific configurations.

member.param: Optimization level to enable - one of following: off, size, speed, on(or full)

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.buildoptions(System.String[])
member.summary: Passes arguments directly to the compiler command line without translation.

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.linkoptions(System.String[])
member.summary: Passes arguments directly to the linker command line without translation.

member.name: M:SolutionProjectBuilder.objectfilename(System.String)

value to config line translator function. Function can return null if no lines needs to be provided.
If value cannot be configured in style - enabled/disable (one kind of flag only - enable) - specify here default value

Full path from where project was loaded.
true to process sub-project, false not

member.summary: Same as Exception, only we save call stack in here (to be able to report error line later on).

member.summary: Creates new exception with stack trace from where exception was thrown.
